name: otex
params: class c0, class c1, class c2

stmt.origin: eqeltri(cotp(c0, c1, c2), universe, cop(cop(c0, c1), c2))
stmt.pretty: eqeltri(< c0, c1, c2 >, universe, < < c0, c1 >, c2 >)

body.origin:
|- wcel(cotp(c0, c1, c2), universe)
-| wceq(cotp(c0, c1, c2), cop(cop(c0, c1), c2))
-| wcel(cop(cop(c0, c1), c2), universe)

cumulated.origin:
|- wcel(cotp(c0, c1, c2), universe)
-| wceq(cotp(c0, c1, c2), cop(cop(c0, c1), c2))
-| wcel(cop(cop(c0, c1), c2), universe)

body.origin: |- wceq(cotp(c0, c1, c2), cop(cop(c0, c1), c2))

cumulated.origin:
|- wcel(cotp(c0, c1, c2), universe)
-| wcel(cop(cop(c0, c1), c2), universe)

comment: An ordered triple of classes is a set. (Contributed by NM, 3-Apr-2015.)
